intro: Cerinthe lamprocarpa f. verruculosa, commonly known as the warty cerinthe, is a variant of the cerinthe plant characterized by its distinctive warty or swollen stems. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is native to southern Europe, particularly the Iberian Peninsula. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture and produces clusters of blue to purple flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or borders. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
